intro: Hieracium poecilocybe, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and the plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Hieracium poecilocybe plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
